video.title: Sandōkai 參同契  - "Merging of Difference and Unity" - Shitou Xiqian - Zen Buddhism
video.description:
Sandōkai - written in the 8th century by  Chinese Zen ancestor Sekito Kisen, a disciple of the sixth patriarch, Eno, it is one of the most important texts in the Soto Zen school . 
San: many, difference, form. Do: unity, identity, ku (emptiness); kai: meeting.
Several translations are possible: identity of the many and the one; meeting of identity and difference; uniqueness of reality and emptiness, etc.
The Sandokai deals with the realization of the fundamental unity at the heart of contradictions and of the duality created by our brain.
Translated by Masunaga Reihō 
Some notes on the  text can be found here: https://www.existentialbuddhist.com/tag/sandokai/

Calligraphy by Taisen Deshimaru Roshi (1914-1982)
Music: Grace of Silence - Yatao Handpan duo
